title: Ticket #5649: Docker Universe does not set GID
description:
The Docker universe does not add the gid when running a docker instance. This results in a process running inside a Docker container having a regular UID, but GID = 0.

We found this a problem when attempting to run glideins inside a docker instance. The code at: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/1045b29/src/condor_utils/uids.cpp#L1098-L1104

This stops condor if the GID is set to 0, and it cannot do priv changes. I believe the code at: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor/blob/bb94e12/src/condor_starter.V6.1/docker-api.cpp#L128 needs to be updated to add the gid, which is in the form of <uid>:<gid>.

We tested adding the GID with a simple wrapper, and the glidein successfully worked. 

#!/usr/bin/env python

import sys
import subprocess
import pwd

args = sys.argv
args.pop(0)
args.insert(0, '/usr/bin/docker')

try:
    idx = args.index('--user')
    u_idx = idx+1

    uid_num = int(args[u_idx])
    gid_num = pwd.getpwuid(uid_num).pw_gid

    args[u_idx] = '%d:%d' % (uid_num, gid_num)
except ValueError:
    pass

subprocess.call(args)
